meanings.definition: Not confident or assured; uncertain and anxious.
meanings.sent1: She felt insecure about speaking in front of the class.
meanings.sent2: He always seemed insecure when meeting new people.
meanings.sent3: The insecure puppy kept hiding behind its owner's legs.
meanings.sent4: Her insecure thoughts were like dark clouds looming over her mind.
meanings.sent5: The creaky old bridge felt as insecure as a shaky ladder.

meanings.sent1: The insecure table wobbled whenever someone touched it.
meanings.sent2: His insecure grip on the rope made him slip.
meanings.sent3: The insecure chair seemed to have a mind of its own, tipping over unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The insecure foundation of the building made it sway in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The insecure ladder swayed dangerously as he climbed higher.

meanings.definition: Not adequately protected or guarded; not safe.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the door unlocked made the house insecure.
meanings.sent2: The old lock was insecure and easily broken.
meanings.sent3: The insecure fence couldn't keep the mischievous goats out of the garden.
meanings.sent4: The insecure password left his accounts vulnerable to hackers.
meanings.sent5: The insecure window rattled in the strong wind, threatening to break.
